item.title: Responsive web designs through EQCSS
item.description: EQCSS allows us to style elements based on the element’s state. It is similar to CSS’ media queries, but with the added feature to style elements based on the element’s dimension and contents, and not just based on the browser’s width and height. This got me interested since my previous project’s longstanding issue was with how the app should look like based on a combination of two factors: The window’s size and the number of elements inside the container.
